definition: worthwhile (often in rhetorical questions, implying not worthwhile)/also written 犯得上
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: Are we in that big of a hurry to get to an engagement party?
sentences.chinese: 去参加个订婚晚会我们也犯得着那么着急吗？

definition: not worthwhile
see 犯不著|犯不着[fan4 bu5 zhao2]
worthwhile (often in rhetorical questions, implying not worthwhile)
to muster large forces/to get a great number of people involved (in carrying out some task)
why bother?/is it worth the trouble?
to ask for trouble/to bring misfortune on oneself
see 幹嘛|干嘛[gan4 ma2]
see 幹嘛|干嘛[gan4 ma2]
one's utmost/(to fight or work) desperately hard/to put up a life or death struggle/at all costs
to take great pains/to go to a lot of trouble
intentional/deliberate/on purpose
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
(coll.) Don't waste your breath./Save it!
(followed by a verb phrase, then – optionally – 不可, or 不行 etc) must
unlike/in contrast to
to play games/to joke around/to play a joke on sb
